me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.control

Interface Controller

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractController, AngleDeltaController, GenericTurnController, ProportionalController, SimpleSwerveModuleController, SplineController

    public interface Controller
    A feedback-based controller. Controllers function by receiving some form of input and returning some form of output.

    Most simply, a controller has a couple of components. Firstly, a controller has a target value. Secondly, a controller has a stream of input values. For each of these input values, the controller will output a value that it "thinks" will bring the next input value closer to the target value.

    Like many other interfaces in this library, there's an abstract class that's probably more convenient to work with than simply using the interface. Go take a look at the AbstractController.

    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

      • setMin

        void setMin(double min)
        Set the controller's minimum output value.
        Parameters:
        min - the controller's minimum output value. Any output below this value will automatically be set to this value.

      • setMax

        void setMax(double max)
        Set the controller's maximum output value.
        Parameters:
        max - the controller's maximum output value. Any output above this value will automatically be set to this value.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset the controller. Some controllers have no use for this method, but it's there anyways because my code sucks and I'm too lazy to change it.

      • getTarget

        double getTarget()
        Get the controller's target value.
        Returns:
        the controller's target value.

      • setTarget

        void setTarget(double target)
        Set the controller's target value.
        Parameters:
        target - the controller's target value.

      • calculate

        double calculate(double value)
        Use an input reading to determine an output.
        Parameters:
        value - the input the controller should calculate for.
        Returns:
        a value calculated by the controller.

      • calculate

        double calculate(double value,
                 double target)
        Use an input reading to determine an output. Also, set the target point. It's a real two-in-one, you know?
        Parameters:
        value - the input the controller should calculate for.
        target - the value the controller should attempt to reach.
        Returns:
        a value calculated by the controller.
